title: TidyTuesday
contents:
TidyTuesday
TidyTuesday is a weekly social data project in R - hosted by the R4DS Online Learning Community. The intent of Tidy Tuesday is to provide a safe community to practice your wrangling and data visualization skills. I am a regular contributor and all of my visualization are created solely using ggplot() and other extension packages.
All of my contributions + code can be found here.
Some Personal (& Recent) Favorites
Toronto Shelters - Data Source: {opendatatoronto}



Washington Trails - Data Source: WTA


Extinct Plants - Data Source: IUCN Red List



Avatar: The Last Airbender - Data Source: {appa}

title: Welcome to my personal site
contents: Welcome to my new blog. Hopefully there are additional posts after this one. Here is a picture of Waffles as a little treat.

title: COVID-19 Visualization
description: An infectious disease natural history primer for the public
contents:
Managing the COVID-19 Pandemic Course
U.C. Berkeley School of Public Health has an online, self-paced course to provide the public a comprehensive understanding of the COVID-19 pandemic.
As part of this course, Dr.Â Sandi McCoy gave a lecture regarding proven interventions and and what we know works. To support this presentation, I created a visualization how the natural history of some of the most commonly known pathogens changes the mitigation and control strategies that are effective.



This course can be found here.
